command: [withheld] PowerShell runs cscript.exe to call prnport.vbs with suspicious parameters that culminate in unexpected process execution (details redacted).
explanation: Signed printing scripts like prnport.vbs can be misused as a proxy for executing other code. Detection focuses on anomalous argument patterns and child process creation.
rationale_steps: Flag powershell.exe -> cscript.exe with prnport.vbs in command line.
Look for non-standard port/printer arguments or embedded tokens.
Child process from cscript.exe deviates from expected behavior (e.g., spawns an interpreter).
No new ports/printers actually created per system logs.
Execution originates from user space and not an installer/IT tool.
